Jordan, yes. Take a look at this chart that describes steps to defining words you don't know.
Step 1 shows us that we have to find context clues. You do this by looking for words or phrases in the surrounding sentences in a passage.
You can find words that have similar or different meanings that will help you figure out the definition of the word you don't know.
So context clues are kind of like little hints that guide us to the possible definition of a word! Got it!
In this activity if you are struggling with finding context clues, # I will help you by flashing certain context clues in the passage to help you figure out the definition.

from there we replace our definition in the sentence to see if it makes sense, then if it does make sense, we got the definition! If not, we have to start over at step one.

Finally, In step 4, You ask yourself, does my definition of the word make sense in the sentence? If it does, then you got it. You just defined a word you didn't know. # But if it doesn't, then go back to step one until your definition fits the sentence

Question.text: _user_, can you help me define the highlighted word? The word is sprawling... select one of the answer choices below.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Sprawling means to cover a large area in an untidy way. So, here we learn that galaxies cover large areas of the universe and they can appear untidy.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: Ok, let's look at the context clues, countless. # If there are countless numbers of stars that cannot be counted, Will these stars cover a small area or will they cover large areas? # Use this hint to define the word sprawling. Please give this question another try and choose an answer below.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ did you need more time picking a definition? Try again now!

Answer.name: Assertion
Answer.text: sprawling means to cover a large area in an untidy way. # So, here we learn that galaxies cover large areas of the universe and they can appear untidy.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, do you agree with this definition of sprawling?

Answer.name: JordanDisagree
Answer.text: I don't know, I thought sprawling meant to injure your body.

Answer.name: JordanAgree
Answer.text: It sounds right to me.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree
Answer.text: I thought this was the correct answer! An example is a forest, A forest is sprawling because it covers a large area!

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand
Answer.text: ok. I get it. So for example a forest is sprawling because it covers a large area just like a galaxy!

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
Answer.text: I see how i was wrong. I thought sprawling meant injure yourself because sprawl rhymes with fall.

Question.text: Here is another word I'm having trouble with. The word is consist, _user_, can you pick the best definition below?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The word consist means to be made or formed from two or more things. So for example the Milky Way Galaxy is made of a flat disk and spiral arms.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: Take a look at the context clues that are shown here. Try to refer to the phrase includes stars, planets, dust, and gas. # All of these things create a galaxy, so what is the definition of the word consist? choose an answer below.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: _user_, did you need more time picking a definition for consist. Try again

Answer.name: Assertion
Answer.text: the word consist means to be made or formed from two or more things. So the Milky Way Galaxy is made of a flat disk and spiral arms.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think of this choice?

Answer.name: JordanDisagree
Answer.text: I don't know, that does not sound right to me.

Answer.name: JordanAgree
Answer.text: I think this is the correct definition of consist.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree
Answer.text: So that's what that means when people ask, what did your day consist of! They are asking what was my day made up of. I thought so.

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand
Answer.text: ok. I think I understand. So consist means to be made up of something, so for example a pizza consists of cheese and dough. That means a pizza is made up of cheese and dough!

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
Answer.text: Ok. that answer makes sense. So consist means to be made of something, like a car is made up of an engine and tires.

Question.text: _user_ ,this word is bulging. Can you help me define it? Select from the answers below.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Bulging means that something looks larger and rounder or fuller than normal. # So the Milky Way Galaxy is made up of or consists of a flat disk that has a large and round center with spiral arms.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt

Answer.name: Assertion

Answer.name: AskJordan

Answer.name: JordanAgree

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree

Answer.name: JordanDisagree

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand

Question.text: Ok here is another word I'm unsure of. The word is distinctive. _user_, Can you define it for me? Pick one of the choices below.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Distinctive means that something is easy to recognize or see because it is different from other things around it. # The spinning motion caused by the rotating of the matter in the galaxy causes the disk to take on a recognizable spiral shape. # The spiral shape is different from the other shapes seen in the galaxy.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt

Answer.name: Assertion

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan do you agree or disagree with this definition for distinctive?

Answer.name: JordanAgree
Answer.text: I agree with this definition!

Answer.name: JordanDisagree
Answer.text: Is it wrong?

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand
Answer.text: I see. So something is distinctive when it looks different, like an 18 wheeler. # 18 wheelers are distinctive trucks because they are larger and different than the smaller cars we are used to seeing.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree
Answer.text: I thought that was the right answer! So something is distinctive if it stands out or looks different, like an 18 wheeler. # 18 wheelers are distinctive trucks because they are larger and different than the smaller cars we are used to seeing.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
Answer.text: I see. So something is distinctive if it stands out or is different like an 18 wheeler. # 18 wheelers are distinctive trucks because they are larger and different than the smaller cars we are used to seeing.

Question.text: ok. I found the next word I need help with. It's elongated! I don’t know what this word means! _user_, do you know what elongated means? Pick an answer from below.

Question.text: Here is the second word. The word is relatively. _user_, can you define it for me? Pick from the answers below.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Relatively can mean comparing two or more objects. Black holes formed by the collapse of individual stars are very small. # So relatively small means that compared to other things around it that are larger, it is very small.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: ok. Let's look at the context clues in the sentence here. Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ did you need more time defining relatively? Give it another shot!

Answer.name: Assertion
Answer.text: The word relatively can mean comparing two or more objects. Black holes formed by the collapse of individual stars are very small. So relatively small means that compared to other things around it that are larger, it is very small.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan do you agree with this answer?

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand
